tumor_type.column_description: Tumor Type; e.g. Primary, Type 1, Type 2

vital_status.column_description: Survival state of the participant; e.g. dead, alive

other_malignancy_type.column_description: Indicates whether another malignancy occurred before or at the same time; e.g. Prior Malignancy, Synchronous Malignancy

person_neoplasm_cancer_status.column_description: The participant's cancer status; e.g. With Tumor, Tumor Free

pathologic_N.column_description: The pathologic N score is a rating of the extent of cancer within nearby lymph nodes, based on surgery or biopsy; e.g. N1, N2, N3

clinical_T.column_description: The clinical T score is a rating of the extent of the primary tumor, based on results of tests done before surgery, such as physical exams and imaging scans; e.g. T1, T2, T3, T4

tss_code.column_description: Tissue Source Site Code; see https://gdc.cancer.gov/resources-TCGA-users/TCGA-code-tables/tissue-source-site-codes for explanation of codes

pathologic_stage.column_description: The stage of the cancer, based on surgery or biopsy; e.g. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III, Stage IV

psa_value.column_description: A male participant's Prostrate-Specific Antigen (PSA) value

other_malignancy_anatomic_site.column_description: The site on the body where the other malignancy occurred; e.g. Bladder, Uterus, etc.

history_of_neoadjuvant_treatment.column_description: Describes the patient's history of neoadjuvant treatment and the kind of treament given prior to resection of the tumor; e.g. Yes, Pharmaceutical Treatment Prior to Resection, etc.

age_at_diagnosis.column_description: Age, in years, at which a condition or disease was first diagnosed

icd_10.column_description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the disease code from the tenth version of the International Classification of Disease (ICD-10)

ethnicity.column_description: The ethnic origination of a participant, independent from race; e.g. Not Hispanic or Latino, Hispanic or Latino

days_to_birth.column_description: Days since birth (a negative value, relative to the date of diagnosis which is considered to be t=0)

hpv_calls.column_description: HPV strains; e.g. HPV18, HPV45, etc.

number_pack_years_smoked.column_description: The number of packs smoked per day times the number of years smoked by the participant

residual_tumor.column_description: Status of the tissue margin following surgical resection; e.g. R0, R1, R2, RX

batch_number.column_description: The BCR Batch Code; see https://gdc.cancer.gov/resources-TCGA-users/TCGA-code-tables/bcr-batch-codes for explanation of the codes

program_name.column_description: Program Name, always TCGA (The Cancer Genome Atlas) in this table.

gleason_score_combined.column_description: The Gleason Score (ranging from 1 -5) is the grade of the aggressiveness of prostate cancer. The combined Gleason Score is the primary Gleason score  (for the largest area of the tumor) added to the secondary Gleason Score (for the next largest section of the tumor).

menopause_status.column_description: A female participant's menopausal status; e.g. Post, Pre, Indeterminate, Peri

pregnancies.column_description: The number of times (including currently if it applies) that a female participant has been pregnant, regardless of outcome.

clinical_N.column_description: The clinical N score is a rating of the extent of cancer within nearby lymph nodes, based on results of tests done before surgery, such as physical exams and imaging scans; e.g. N1, N2, N3

clinical_M.column_description: The clinical M score is a rating of metastasis, that is, how much cancer has spread to distant sites. It is based on results of tests done before surgery, such as physical exams and imaging scans; e.g. MX, M0, M1

primary_therapy_outcome_success.column_description: Kind of outcome achieved after the completion of the initial course of treatment; e.g. Complete Remission/Response, Progressive Disease, etc.

other_dx.column_description: Indicator and type of other diagnosis; e.g. No; Yes, History of Prior Malignancy; Yes, History of Synchronous/Bilateral Malignancy; Both History of Synchronous/Bilateral and Prior Malignancy

country.column_description: Country of the participant; e.g. Germany, United States, Canada, etc.

days_to_submitted_specimen_dx.column_description: Numeric value to represent the day of the diagnosis for the submitted sample.

histological_type.column_description: The histological type of cancer; e.g. Adenosquamous, Astrocytoma, etc.

race.column_description: The race of a participant, independent from ethnicity; e.g. White, Black or African American, Asian, Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander, American Indian or Alaska Native

h_pylori_infection.column_description: Indicator of previous or current diagnosis of Helicobactor pylori infection; e.g. Yes, No, Never, Current

new_tumor_event_after_initial_treatment.column_description: Indicates whether a patient has had a new tumor event after initial treatment; Yes, No

days_to_last_known_alive.column_description: Number of days from the date of diagnosis to the last day on which a person was known to be alive. This field is a combination of the days_to_last_followup and days_to death fields. Therefore, this field can be used whether the vital_status is 'alive' or 'dead'.

program_dbgap_accession_number.column_description: Program dbGaP accession number, eg phs000178

year_of_initial_pathologic_diagnosis.column_description: Four digit year of the initial pathologic diagnosis

icd_o_3_histology.column_description: Code that represents the histology of the disease using the third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms

tumor_tissue_site.column_description: The location on the body where the tumor exists; e.g. Brain, Ovary, Lung, etc.

tobacco_smoking_history.column_description: Category describing current smoking status and smoking history as self-reported by a participant.; e.g. 1, 2, etc.

number_of_lymphnodes_examined.column_description: The number of lymph nodes examined

age_began_smoking_in_years.column_description: Age, in years, that the participant began smoking

bcr.column_description: Biospecimen Core Resource; e.g. Nationwide Children's Hospital, Washington University

history_of_colon_polyps.column_description: Indicator if the participant had a previous history of colon polyps as noted in the history/physical or previous endoscopic report(s); e.g. Yes, No

stopped_smoking_year.column_description: Four-digit year that the participant stopped smoking; e.g. 2010

other_malignancy_histological_type.column_description: The histological type of cancer of the other malignancy; e.g. Adenosquamous, Astrocytoma, etc.

lymphatic_invasion.column_description: Indicator if small or thin-walled vessel invasion is present, indicating lymphatic involvement; e.g. Yes, No

year_of_tobacco_smoking_onset.column_description: Four-digit year that the participant started smoking; e.g. 2010

disease_code.column_description: A code representing the type of cancer. Values can be found at https://gdc.cancer.gov/resources-TCGA-users/TCGA-code-tables/TCGA-study-abbreviations; e.g. OV, GBM, LUAD

anatomic_neoplasm_subdivision.column_description: The spatial location, subdivisions and/or atomic site name of a tumor; e.g. Rectum, Larynx, Tonsil, etc.

mononucleotide_and_dinucleotide_marker_p.column_description: Status of the mononucleotide and dinucleotide marker panel analysis; microsatellite-stable (MSS), low level MSI (MSI-L) if less than 40% of markers were altered and high level MSI (MSI-H) if greater than 40% of markers were altered

project_name.column_description: Project Name; frequently the same as or similar to the project disease type eg   Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia - Phase II   or   Breast Invasive Carcinoma   etc

days_to_last_followup.column_description: If vital_status indicates 'alive', then this is the number of days from the date of diagnosis to the last followup (communication contact).

neoplasm_histologic_grade.column_description: Rating which expresses the degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation and aggressiveness; e.g. G1, G2, G3, G4

days_to_death.column_description: If vital_status indicates 'dead', then this is the number of days to death (a positive value) relative to the date of diagnosis.

case_gdc_id.column_description: GDC unique identifer for this case; e.g. 7b4ce492-ff40-4bf1-b3e8-75ff83e8746d. This identifier can be used to find more information at the GDC Data Portal ( https://portal.gdc.cancer.gov/cases/7b4ce492-ff40-4bf1-b3e8-75ff83e8746d )

primary_neoplasm_melanoma_dx.column_description: Indicates whether a person had a primary diagnosis of melanoma; e.g. Yes, No

number_of_lymphnodes_positive_by_he.column_description: The number of lymph nodes involved with disease as determined by histological examination

venous_invasion.column_description: Indicator if large vessel or venous invasion was detected by surgery or presence in a tumor specimen; e.g. Yes, No

project_short_name.column_description: Project name abbreviation; the program name appended with a project name abbreviation; e.g. TCGA-OV, etc.

days_to_initial_pathologic_diagnosis.column_description: The number of days to initial pathologic diagnosis

icd_o_3_site.column_description: Code that represents the site of the disease using the third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms

pathologic_T.column_description: The pathologic T score is a rating of the extent of the primary tumor, based on surgery or biopsy; e.g. T1, T2, T3, T4

colorectal_cancer.column_description: Indicates whether the participant has colorectal cancer; e.g. Yes, No

hpv_status.column_description: Indicates whether the participant has a record of a positive finding for human papillomavirus; e.g. Positive, Negative, Indeterminate

pathologic_M.column_description: The pathologic M score is a rating of metastasis, that is, how much cancer has spread to distant sites. It is based on surgery or biopsy; e.g. MX, M0, M1

lymphnodes_examined.column_description: Indicator whether the lymph nodes were examined; e.g. Yes, No

lymphovascular_invasion_present.column_description: Indicator if  invasion of a cancer to the blood vessels and/or lymphatics invasion is present; e.g. Yes, No

clinical_stage.column_description: The stage of the cancer, based on results of tests done before surgery, such as physical exams and imaging scans; e.g. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III, Stage IV
